articles.author: Artorn Pookasook, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel expanded its targets in its war with Hezbollah militants in Lebanon on Monday, killing at least 21 people in an airstrike in the north, health officials said, while millions of Israelis took shelter from projectiles fired back across the border.
articles.title: Israel strikes north Lebanon town, UN expresses concern about peacekeepers

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Tuesday it had detected a record number of 153 Chinese military aircraft participating in China's war games around the island the previous day, detailing a surge in warplane activity.
articles.title: Taiwan details record surge in planes in China's war games, flags risk to region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has blown up sections of an inter-Korean road on its side of the heavily militarised border between the two Koreas, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean road on its side of border, Seoul says

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Sakshi Dayal, Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Earlier in the day, India said it had ordered the expulsion of six high-ranking Canadian diplomats and withdrawn its envoy from Canada.
articles.title: Canada expels top India diplomats, links them to murder of Sikh leader

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: The United States has warned the Iranian government to stop all plotting against Republican Donald Trump and said that Washington would view any attempt on his life as an act of war, a U.S. official said on Monday.
articles.title: US warns Iran to stop plotting against Trump, says US official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lawmakers in Mexico's lower house of Congress voted on Monday to approve legislation to implement a controversial judicial overhaul that will move the country to a system of judges elected by popular vote.
articles.title: Mexico's lower house lawmakers pass bill to implement judicial reform in lopsided vote

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Police arrested more than 200 pro-Palestinian demonstrators who had staged a sit-in outside the New York Stock Exchange on Monday to demand an end to U.S. support for Israel's war in Gaza, authorities said.
articles.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested outside New York Stock Exchange

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's chief of staff called on Monday for a new international security system to preclude future instances of armed aggression, as he addressed an online conference on securing peace following Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Ukraine holds new online conference on peace, calls for revised security system

articles.author: James Pomfret
articles.description: Hong Kong is expected to announce measures to boost the city's economy in its annual policy address on Wednesday, including slashing liquor tariffs, as it seeks to revive the financial hub which has been struggling to recover since the pandemic.
articles.title: Hong Kong policy address seen pivoting from security to economic growth

articles.author: Danial Azhar
articles.description: Malaysia will likely introduce further subsidy cuts and new taxes as part of its budget for next year, analysts and economists said, as it looks to strengthen its fiscal position amid expectations of falling government revenue.
articles.title: Malaysia eyes more subsidy cuts, new taxes in 2025 budget to boost finances
